metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4052 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in Squid 3.x before 3.5.17 and 4.x before 4.0.9 allow remote HTTP servers to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code via crafted Edge Side Includes (ESI) responses.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2').
